Name: Stela of Seneb
Description: The rounded upper part of this stela contains two representations of Wepwawet reclining on a pedestal, facing each other. In Abydos, Wepwawet was considered to be identical to the jackal god Anubis. The five registers underneath show the chief of the treasury Seneb with his relatives. In the upper left corner, Seneb is seated on a chair with lion's legs. The vertical lines of text in front of him contain the offering formula for Osiris. The other twenty-four people also ensured their permanent presence in Abydos by adding their names to this stela.
